topic.title: HPE Helion 2.0 Development Platform: ALS Command Reference: Administration

ul.li: helion admin grant: Grant the named user administrator privileges for the current or specified target.
helion admin list: Show a list of the administrators for the current or specified target.
helion admin patch: Apply a patch to the current or specified target.
helion admin report: Retrieve a report containing the logs of the current or specified target.
helion admin revoke:Revoke administrator privileges for the named user at the current or specified target.
helion info: Show the basic system and account information.
helion show-token: Print the current target's authorization token.
helion stacks: List the supported stacks of the target.
helion targets: List the available targets and their authorization tokens, if any.
helion tokens: List the available targets and their authorization tokens, if any.
helion usage: Show the current memory allocation and usage of the specified or current space.
helion user: Show the name of the current user in the current or specified target.
helion user-info: Shows the information of a user in the current or specified target.
helion version: Print the version number of the client.

section.title: Syntax
section.p: For more information, use the helion help or helion help [command] commands.

section.title: helion admin grant <email>
section.p: Grant the named user administrator privileges for the current or specified target.

row.entry: Activate tracing of the issued REST requests and responses. This option is a no-op now. Tracing is always active. See the 'trace' command to print the saved trace to stdout.

section.title: helion admin list
section.p: Show a list of the administrators for the current or specified target.

row.entry: Print raw json as output, not human-formatted data.
The once-off target to use for the current operation.
The once-off authentication token to use for the current operation.
Path to an existing and readable file containing the targets and authorization tokens.
Activate tracing of the issued REST requests and responses. This option is a no-op now. Tracing is always active. See the 'trace' command to print the saved trace to stdout.

section.title: helion admin patch <patch>
section.p: Apply a patch to the current or specified target.

row.entry: Print the low-level ssh command to stdout instead of executing it.
The once-off target to use for the current operation.
The once-off authentication token to use for the current operation.
Path to an existing and readable file containing the targets and authorization tokens.
Activate tracing of the issued REST requests and responses. This option is a no-op now. Tracing is always active. See the 'trace' command to print the saved trace to stdout.

section.title: helion admin report <destination>
section.p: Retrieve a report containing the logs of the current or specified target.

row.entry: The once-off target to use for the current operation.
The once-off authentication token to use for the current operation.
Path to an existing and readable file containing the targets and authorization tokens.
Activate tracing of the issued REST requests and responses. This option is a no-op now. Tracing is always active. See the 'trace' command to print the saved trace to stdout.

section.title: helion admin revoke <email>
section.p: Revoke administrator privileges for the named user at the current or specified target.

row.entry: Activate tracing of the issued REST requests and responses. This option is a no-op now. Tracing is always active. See the 'trace' command to print the saved trace to stdout.

section.title: helion info
section.p: Show the basic system and account information.

row.entry: The once-off group to use for the current operation. This is a Application Lifecycle Service 2 option.
Print raw json as output, not human-formatted data.
The once-off organization to use for the current operation.
The once-off space to use for the current operation, specified by name. Cannot be used together with --space-guid.
The once-off space to use for the current operation, specified by guid. Cannot be used together with --space.
The once-off target to use for the current operation.
The once-off authentication token to use for the current operation.
Path to an existing and readable file containing the targets and authorization tokens.

section.p: Shows the information of a user in the current or specified target. Defaults to the current user.
